turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: You're an original, Joe.  A little hard to figure, maybe...

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: And you're a nice man, Quince.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: C'mon, have a drink.  You look like you need one bad as me.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Do I?  I'm a little confused.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: 'Love'?  Oh, man, I've got troubles of my own.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: I was a world-class loser and she was a happy, little rich girl -- and for some reason she took me in.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: Because there's nothing we don't know about each other and it's okay. I mean the deeper, darkest secrets -- they don't matter.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: Yeah, it's like you know every inch of each other's souls -- and then you're free.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: Free to love each other.  Com- pletely.  Totally.  No fear.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Oh yes, you are one of my favorites.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: What would you say if you knew it was me who brought down Bill Parrish?  I told Drew and the Board that Bill depended on you.  Drew led me on, but I had no business telling him in the first place.  He was setting up Bill from day one.  Drew and Bontecou are going to chop up the company and sell it off for parts. Bontecou was outside, Drew was Mr. Inside.  And I was the fool who made it all happen.  Oh God, what do I do?

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: You think so?  How do you know?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Because that's the kind of man Bill Parrish is.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: Do you think I should wait to tell him 'till after the party?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: -- Can't seem to escape you today.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: You appear at his side out-of-the- blue, stay at his house, eat dinner with his family, it's practically a first.  You're in the red-hot center of big business and I thought you were a regular Joe.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Not the one I met this morning, hit- ting on me in as nice a way as I've been hit on in a long time, but the moment you find out I'm my Dad's daughter, you act like a stranger.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: What are your intentions?  To make little dreams in coffee shops, turn a woman's head, and I don't mind admitting it was turned, I liked it, but ten hours later I feel like a fool.  I don't get it.  You, my father, here in this house, the cof- fee shop, it's making me upset, and I don't like being upset.  Who are you anyway?  And what are you eating?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: You act like you never had peanut butter before --

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: -- What kind of childhood did you have?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: When you put your mouth to his, Susan, it seems a frequent thing.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Drew is none of your damn business. Nor is where I put my mouth.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I'm sorry.  Do you live here?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: No, Joe, I'm swimming here.  Then I'm going home.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I guess what I'm trying to say is -- I'd like us to be friends.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I have a certain function to per- form, and that seems to take all of my time.  Bu sometimes - uh - I speculate - uh - I haven't left room for - uh - anything else.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I'm sorry to say I know what you're saying.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Did you know you have a wet spot on your shoulder?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I think you want to go to the west wing.  Through there.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: How nice you look.  Is that your uniform?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Then why are you here, Joe?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I don't have any time to see you now.  I'm doing grand rounds and then I'm examining back-to-back patients until dinner and then --

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: That's impossible.  I'm a doctor, I'm --

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: She's in a great deal of pain.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I have to go, I'm sorry to say --

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I thought you said 'Be sorry for nothing'.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Well, now I am sorry.  For intruding on you this afternoon.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: It wasn't an intrusion.  And if it was, it turned out to be welcome.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Why do you love peanut butter so much?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I adore things like that....food I can't do without.  Don't you?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I'm very concerned about the woman you attended to today.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: We're doing what we can for her. But it doesn't look good.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: How long have you been standing there?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I don't like the way Drew spoken to you.  But I feel better about it now because of the way you spoke back.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Because guys who never say anything about themselves are always married.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Why don't you get off his case?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Please.  We don't need to talk about Drew.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Never tried, 'til now.  Joe, may I kiss you?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I don't know who you are.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Well...I'm -- uh, Joe.  And you're Susan.  And I - uh - have this weak feeling in my knees --

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: And is your heart beating strangely?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Faster.  And I want the scent from underneath your ears and the taste of your lips and the touch of your tongue to stay with me -- forever.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I just thought I'd drop by, scrounge a little lunch, I was in the neigh- borhood --

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: He must be tired -- this Bontecou thing --

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Yes, he's tired.  I believe so.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Maybe it's the draft through the door.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Did you like making love to me?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: More than you love peanut butter?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Oh, I hope a long, long time.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I like you in a black tie.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I love you in an evening gown.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: It beats a surgical, doesn't it?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Yes.  Your father and I, our time together has come to an end.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: And you can't tell me who you are.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I can tell you the when part.  Tonight.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: No worse than it gets for me.  I'm in love with a woman whom I don't want to leave.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: We know so little about each other --

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: We know all that we need to know --

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: But there's so much to tell you --

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Lightning struck.  We caught it in a bottle.  Don't let it out.  I want to be with you, Joe --

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Yes, that's why I said it.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: And I said you'd have a hard time finding a woman like that.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: -- That was the place... and you were the guy.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: You want me to wait for you, you'll be back --

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: But you're not.  You're somewhere else.  You're someone else --

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Tell me you love me -- tell me you love me now --

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I love you now, I'll love you always --

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Well, I don't know what else to say. It's a helluva party --

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Yeah...and you're the prettier thing here.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Joe knows what you're saying, just being polite --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: ...I'm sorry, I'm a little discon- certed, that stuff between you and Susan -- uh -- threw me.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Shook me up.  I mean that you knew her and everything --

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I didn't know her.  The body I took knew her.  The man she met in the coffee shop this morning.  I - uh - took him.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: So there's nothing between you and Susan?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I wish you had said something to me about staying here --

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: It hadn't occurred to me until then. I was just having such a wonderful time -- Besides, isn't this what I'm here for?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Thank you.  Would you like the man's name?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: If there is anything else, don't hesitate --

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You're putting me on the spot, Bill.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: That's the best I can do.  ...but minute-by-minute, I find myself lingering.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: ...I just saw my doctor, he told me everything was fine.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Your doctor?  Did your doctor say anything about a tiny, undetectable hole in your aorta?  Did he mention an irreparab- ly weak vein in the further reaches of your famous brain?  Were there any prognostications about the possibil- ilites of a fatal collision on a golf cart or suffocating in an avalanche on a ski vacation in Gstaad?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I hope you realize, Bill...in your office this morning, that was your time.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Well, thank you for letting me know.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: How are you?  How're you feeling?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: 'Feeling'?  I feel fine.  How do you feel?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Um -- well, I didn't sleep too well. This is crazy.  This is the left- field thing of all time.  What do I do?  What do I tell my family?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Oh, I wouldn't tell them anything, Bill.  You'll ruin the good start we had last night.  I felt as if I were being treated like a person.  'Joe' this and 'Joe' that - a nice smile - Quince passed me the rolls -- no 'rapture' or 'passion' or any of those mighty things you seem so intent on imparting, but I am cer- tain, should you - uh - say - uh - who I am - our adventure would end abruptly.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: And I won't tell anyone who you are.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: You give your word, I give mine -- that we'll do what we say.  It's a truth exchanged between two people.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: When you were shaving this morning, you weren't just shaving, right?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You were hatching ideas, making plans, arriving at decisions, right?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: So you understand the concept then. When you're busy here, your work, what your task is, is being executed elsewhere.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: So you've grasped the idea.  Con- gratulations.  Now multiply it by infinity and take it to the depth of forever, and you still will have barely a glimpse of what I am talking about.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: How about giving a guy a break?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: -- I don't deserve this.  I'm still young, this is not my time --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: What's it like where I'm going?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Perhaps you would like to wait in my office --?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: What I'm trying to say is this is a Board meeting and you are not a mem- ber of the Board.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I'm sure you'll see to it that it won't be a problem.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Would you like to sit down, Joe?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: -- What's the deal here?  Are you going to be breathing down my neck right 'til the very end?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: ...I'd like to be alone for a while.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Yes, I am.  There's a research lib- rary on the fourth floor.  Why don't you go down and read some magazines?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You're not thinking of going some- where, are you, Bill?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Joe, could I ask you to take a walk? Buy a tie or something.  I know I'll be seeing you.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Now I'd like to be alone.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Jennifer, give Mr. Black a map of the city.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: No thank you, Bill.  I can manage.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Are you going to eat your lunch

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Cold lamb sandwich with cilantro.  A little Coleman's mustard.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Glad you like it.  My wife turned me onto cold lamb sandwiches.  Joan -- that was my wife --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Cold lamb sandwiches -- not as chewy as roast beef, not as boring as chicken.  She knew stuff like that.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I thought you'd heard a trillion times --

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Why, at this juncture, are you letting yourself be so concerned by business matters?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I don't want anybody buying up my life's work and turning it into something it wasn't meant to be.  A man wants to leave something behind. And he wants it left behind the way he made it.  And he wants it to be run the way he run it -- with a sense of honor, of dedication, of truth. Okay?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: And I don't need your goddamn permis- sion either!  You!  Drew!  I don't need anyone to tell me how to run my life.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Easy, Bill.  You'll give yourself a heart attack and ruin my vacation.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Why did you go to the hospital?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I wouldn't put it that way.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: What way would you put it?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: How about you telling me?  When I ask a simple question, I expect a straight answer.  That's what I'm used to.  Anybody who doesn't give it to me, I fire.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Are you going to fire me, Bill?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Hello.  Would you like to join me, Quince and Allison for a nightcap?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: What 'okay' is, it's 'okay' it's over.  We've got bigger fish to fry, don't we, Joe?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Never mind.  I'm tired.  I'm going to take a nap.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Yes, I saw you see me.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Well, you're at the wrong place at the wrong time with the wrong woman.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I'll be the judge of that.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: With all due respect, Bill, I'm not asking your permission.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Well, you goddam well should.  You walk into my life, give me the worst news a guy can get, have me dancing on the heads of pins with my busi- ness and with my family, and now you're spooning with my daughter.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Yes, and stop repeating everything I say, and turning it into a question. Spooning, fooling around, God knows what.  You arrive on the scene -- why you picked me, I still don't under- stand --

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I picked you for your verve, your excellence, and for your ability to - how shall I say - instruct.  You've lived a first-rate life.  And I find it eminently usable.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: You're violating the laws of the universe.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Any universe that exists or ever existed.  You may be the pro, Joe. But I know who you are.  And you're all fucked up.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I don't like your tone, and I don't like your references.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: And I don't give a shit.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: May I remind you this is not just a dispute with a putative suitor, this is me.  So watch it...Bill.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Cut the 'Bill' crap out -- you sonofabitch.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: -- I have the feeling that, all in all, what I made this voyage for -- has served its purpose.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: What are you saying, that it's time to go?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: What the hell do you care?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: You 'want to know', I'll tell you. You're looking at a man who tonight is not about to walk through the Valley of the Shadow of Death, he's galloping into it.  And the same time, the business he built with his own hands and his own head is being commandeered by a couple of cheap pirates.  And, oh yes, I almost forgot, my daughter's fallen in love with Death.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: -- And I'm in love with your daughter.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I'm in love with your daughter, and I'm taking her with me tonight.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I think you heard me, Bill.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: You're not taking Susan anywhere. And what the hell does that mean anyway?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Susan is my daughter, she has a wonderful life ahead of her and you're going to deprive her of it and you're telling me you're sorry?  Well, I'm sorry, apology not accepted.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I love her, Bill.  She is all that I ever wanted, and I've never wanted for anything because I've never wanted anything before, if you can understand.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: How perfect for you -- to take whatever you want because it pleases you.  It's not love --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Some aimless infatuation in which, for the moment, you feel like in- dulging.  It's missing everything that matters.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Trust, responsibility, taking the weight, for your choices and feel- ings and spending the rest of your life living up to them.  And above all, not hurting the object of your love.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Multiply it by infinity and take it to the death of forever and you will still have barely a glimpse of what I am talking about.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Susan wants to come.  She says she's in love with me.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: With you?!  Who is 'you'?  Did you tell her who you are?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Does she know where she's going?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I don't like what you're saying.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I certainly hope so -- I loved Susan from the moment she was born, and I love her now, and every minute in between, and what I dream of is a man who will discover her and she will discover a man who will love her, who is worthy of her, who is of this world, of this time and has the grace and compassion and fortitude to walk beside her as she makes her way through this beautiful thing called life.
